para.text: In this chapter, the following terms have the meanings indicated.
CHANGE IS HERE!

"Allotted leave" means a benefit which the Department is either required to provide, for example, personal leave, or which the Department has the option of providing, for example, advanced sick leave.
"Disaster service leave" means leave with pay that may be allotted to an employee to serve during a disaster.

"Donated leave" means leave donated under the Employee-to-Employee Leave Donation Program specified in Regulation .15 of this chapter by one employee to another employee for a serious and prolonged medical condition.
"Earned leave" means a benefit which an employee obtains by performing work, for example, annual leave.
"Employee" means a member of the Career Service, Commission Plan, or Executive Service.
"Full-time employee" means an employee whose standard workweek is at least 40 hours during a 7-day period between Wednesday and Tuesday.
"Leave" means an approved absence from work, with a minimum use rate of 0.1 hour.

"Leave bank leave" means leave granted to an employee who is a member of the State Employees' Leave Bank, as specified in Regulation .15 of this chapter, for a serious and prolonged medical condition.
"Leave with pay" means leave during which an employee receives compensation.
"Leave without pay" means leave during which an employee does not receive cash compensation.

"Overtime" means time spent performing work in excess of 40 hours during a 7-day period between Wednesday and Tuesday or in excess of a tour of duty designated by the appointing authority or the appointing authority's designee for law enforcement or fire protection personnel.
"Part-time employee" means an employee whose standard work hours are less than 40 hours per workweek, and whose fringe benefits are prorated to the extent applicable by law.
"Workday" means the number of hours specified by an appointing authority or the appointing authority's designee in an employee work schedule.
Scope. This regulation governs applications for initial registration as a broker-dealer in Maryland.
National Association of Securities Dealers (NASD) Members. An applicant that is already a member of, or has applied for membership in, the NASD shall:

File with the Central Registration Depository System (CRD) the information required by Form BD (Uniform Application for Broker-Dealer Registration) and the fee required by the Maryland Securities Act, Corporations and Associations Article, ยง11-407, Annotated Code of Maryland; and
CHANGE IS HERE!.
Non-NASD Members.
An applicant that is not a member of, or has not applied for membership in, the NASD shall file with the Commissioner an application upon Form BD (Uniform Application for Broker-Dealer Registration).
The application shall contain:

A financial statement prepared in accordance with 17 CFR ยง240.17a-5(d) (SEC Rule 17a-5(d), Annual Filing of Audited Financial Statements), which is incorporated by reference, as of a date within 90 days of the date on which the statement is filed;
If the applicant is a corporation, a resolution authorizing the filing of the application;
The fee required by the Maryland Securities Act, Corporations and Associations Article, ยง11-407, Annotated Code of Maryland;
A statement or certificate showing compliance with, or exemption from, the examination requirement of Regulation .06 of this chapter; and
Other information the Commissioner may reasonably require.

Completion of Filing. An application for initial registration as a broker-dealer is not considered filed for purposes of the Maryland Securities Act, Corporations and Associations Article, ยง11-405, Annotated Code of Maryland, until:
The applicant has complied with the examination requirement of Regulation .06 of this chapter;
The required fee and all required submissions have been received by the Commissioner;
If the applicant is seeking membership in the NASD, the applicant is approved as a member of the NASD; and
The applicant has submitted any other information the Commissioner has requested.
